question:
You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for display.
Please help me implement the following requirements using SVG code: create a black and white icon featuring an electrical plug connected to a phone charger, along with a portable speaker with a cord.

checklist.title: Is the electrical plug accurately depicted in SVG?
checklist.description: Check if the plug has the correct proportions, prongs, and structural elements typical of an electrical plug. The SVG should use appropriate path elements with precise coordinates. Score 0 if the plug is missing, 5 if basic shape is present but inaccurate, and 10 if the plug is detailed and recognizable.

checklist.title: Is the phone charger component properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the charger is correctly connected to the plug and has appropriate details (adapter body, cable connection points). The SVG implementation should use proper grouping (<g> elements) for related components. Deduct 5 points if the charger lacks distinctive features, 3 points if connection to the plug is unclear. Give 10 points for a well-detailed, recognizable charger.

checklist.title: Is the portable speaker accurately visualized?
checklist.description: Verify if the speaker has recognizable features (speaker grill, volume controls, etc.) and maintains proper proportions. The SVG paths should use appropriate curves and lines to create a realistic speaker shape. Score 0 if the speaker is missing, 5 if only basic outline is present, and 10 if the speaker is detailed and identifiable.

checklist.title: Is the connecting cord between components properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the cord connecting the charger and speaker is implemented with smooth curves using appropriate path commands (like bezier curves). The cord should have consistent thickness and natural bending. Deduct 5 points if the cord uses only straight lines, 3 points if the connections to devices are imprecise. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG code is properly structured with viewBox attribute, appropriate dimensions, and organized elements. Check if the code handles scaling appropriately and maintains aspect ratio. Code with strong robustness should use relative units rather than absolute pixel values. Give 10 points for robust implementation, 5 points for average implementation with minor issues, and 0 points for poor implementation.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG includes additional relevant features (e.g., 1. Animation of power flowing through cord 2. Interactive elements that respond to mouse events 3. Creative use of gradients or patterns to enhance visual appeal). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant path definitions or duplicate elements 2. Elements unrelated to the requested icon components 3. Excessive detail that complicates the SVG without adding clarity. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core design is obscured by redundant elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review the SVG structure including proper naming of elements, use of groups for logical organization, and optimization techniques (path simplification, appropriate decimal precision). Deduct 5 points if elements lack meaningful ids or classes; deduct 5 points if the code is unnecessarily verbose or unoptimized; deduct 5 points if there's no consideration for accessibility (missing title/desc elements). The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the icon design meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the design follows icon design principles: 1) Consistent stroke thickness throughout 2) Proper visual weight balance between elements 3) Clear silhouette recognizable at small sizes. Deduct 3 points for inconsistent line weights, 5 points for poor balance between elements, and 5 points for lack of clarity when scaled down. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the black and white color scheme effectively implemented?
checklist.description: Judge whether the monochromatic design uses black and white effectively: 1) Appropriate contrast between elements 2) Strategic use of negative space 3) Clear visual hierarchy without relying on color. Deduct 5 points for poor contrast making elements hard to distinguish, 3 points for inconsistent use of fills vs. strokes, and 5 points for missed opportunities to use negative space effectively. The full score is 10 points.
